text: I'm Damon bolte bar director at prime
meats in Brooklyn New York and today
we're going to make some punch so here
preemies we make a different punch every
day we usually follow the traditional
guidelines which means it has alcohol
sugar water citrus and some sort of
bitter or aromatic element this was a
little bit more simplified this one
comes from one of my mobile bartenders
here his name is Julian and this one's
called the 15 second punch and we're
about to find out why so the 15 second
punch is one of my favorite types of
recipes because it's all simply equal
parts we start with Jen we've got
compartir the Italian bitter st. Germain
which is an elderflower liqueur
grapefruit and lemon and what we're
going to do we're just going to dump
them all out in a bowl
so once you finish pouring everything
into the bowl garnish it lavishly with
lemons and grapefruits a nice ice mold
make it look pretty so people don't
realize how little work you actually did
and that's the 15 second punch
